newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee recoups gains as roasters buy.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee recoups gains as roasters buy.

text.p: LIFFE robusta coffee futures rebounded from early lows on roaster price-fixing to end Tuesday midsession higher but within pre-opening expectations.
Traders said price movements remained small with the market still struggling to move out of its dull and familiar range.
September gapped $20 higher as expected but moved to a low of $1,762 a tonne before finishing midday $13 up at $1,790.
Traders said the market had been trapped within a $100 price band for the past week amid little exciting news .
"There's some buying at $50 below and selling at $50 higher than current levels," said one.
Traders called the New York market to open about unchanged.
Chartwise, the market was waiting for a break on either side. Analysts said if anything, there's a little pressure on the downside.
Initial support is seen at $1,755, Monday's low, followed by the June 11 low of $1,695.
A break of $1,695 would see a move down to $1,550, the lows not seen since early April.

In other news, the next Brazilian auction of government coffee stocks is now likely to be held on July 15 or July 16, said the secretary-general of the Brazilian Coffee Industry Association (Abic) which represents roasters.

The monthly sale was originally scheduled to be held on July 2 but was postponed pending the official publication of an extension in the payment terms to 120 days from a previous 60 days, said David Nahum.
On the weather front, the private forecaster Weather Services Corp said no damaging cold was in sight for the next five days in Brazil's coffee growing regions.
